cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.AI 

The paper discusses the use of metrics to evaluate research performance in academic institutions, which is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science. Specifically, the paper critiques the Excellence for Research in Australia (ERA) ranking system as applied in forestry, which falls under the digital libraries (cs.DL) and information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses statistical issues associated with bibliometric data, which could be relevant to the cybersecurity (cs.CR) sub-category. The paper also proposes the use of the indirect H2 index as an alternative metric, which could be relevant to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Overall, the paper covers a broad range of topics that could be relevant to several sub-categories in computer science.
